title: Leave Buster problems
body:
i think that riot should stop putting leave busters on their account because the game had crashed for has been disconnected from the network issues or internet difficulties they have. i had a leavebuster again, from my disconnections because the game had said "your game had crashed." and i quit the whole game to restart the connection and next thing you know after tyhe game i got fkn banned for no reason. it was not my fault. why are they banning people that shouldn't be banned. this is also an advise for riot so they don't lose leaguer's just for stupid disconnections. fix this. i now have to wait 20mins for another 5 games. I hope some people out there agrees because people don't deserve to get banned for the game crashing or from internet issues. Riot better read this cause this actually pisses me off. 

erich24q

replies.body:
League is a team game, and your disconnects affect 9 other people every time. It's well understood that internet issues or client crashes happen, and a few dcs here and there will not net you a leaverbuster punishment. 

Hell I play on pretty dodgy adsl internet and even at it's worst (daily issues) I never faced a punishment. How is this relevant to you? It takes a pretty unstable connection to net you leaverbuster punishments, especially up to multiple 20 minute waits. 

> **Everytime you dc, especially for extended periods of time, you are negatively affecting the experience of 9 other players. **

The short of it is that the more you dc the more people you affect and you will face longer waits faster as a result. There is a point when it does not matter if it is directly your fault, you know you are going into a game where you will likely dc and ruin other peoples' experiences, and from the sounds of it you have faced multiple 20 minute leaver busters.

My advice,[ troubleshoot your connection](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/MOopB6Wt-experiencing-a-tech-problem-find-the-common-fixes-here), talk to your ISP about it if you have to (and try using ethernet if you're on wifi), and if you are having client issues as well [follow the fixes for those](http://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/help-support-oce/MOopB6Wt-experiencing-a-tech-problem-find-the-common-fixes-here) as well.
